intro: Nonatelia walkeriana, commonly known as the Walker's nonatelia, is a rare flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
